In the main they relate to persons who had claims to benefit current and were not atwork on the dates given. . . (2) The figures for 25th October, 1926, were affected by the dispute in the Coal-Mining industry. (3) The latest figure available, viz., for the week ended the 26th November, 1928, is given in Part (D)of this Report.(B.) Analysis of the Number of Persons on the Registers of Employment Exchanges in Great Britain at the 22nd October, 1928.-- Men Boys Women. Girls. Total. Increase ( -(-) or Decrease (-) since Sept. 24, 1928.Wholly unemployed Temporary stoppages Casuals . 744,601 238,771 78,926 31,483 6,744 108 121,948 87,710 924 28,248 4,712 12 926,280 337,937 79,970 + 36,413 -t 11,656 -h 884Total 1,062,298 38,335 210,582 32,972 1,344,187 4- 48,953L18546] Printed for the Cabinet. December 1928SECRET. Copy No. 28CP. 373 (28). CABINET. SPECIAL BJEPOET ON UNEMPLOYMENT. No. 165. October 1928. THIS Report gives a summary of the recently published returns ofunemployment in the various industries. In Table (A) is shown the course ofunemployment during October, while Table (B) gives an analysis of the numberof persons on the registers of Employment Exchanges in Great Britain at the22nd October, 1928. The percentage of unemployment (Great Britain) in the insured industries atthe undermentioned dates was October 26, 1925 .... .... .... .... 11*1 ,, . 24, 1927 .... .... .... .... 9-5 ., , , *J'- ,, 22, 1928 .... .... .... .... 117 (men only--13-9) (C.) Unemployment in Insured Industries. The latest date for which unemployment figures by industries are available is the 22nd October, 1928, at which date the percentage unemployed in GreatBritain and Northern Ireland was 11*8, as compared with 11'4 at the24th September, 1928, with 9-5 at the 24th October, 1927, and with 11*4 at the26th October, 1925. The figures at the 22nd October, 1928, in respect ofindustries showing appreciable variations in unemployment during the month,together with the increase or decrease as compared with the previous month andwith a year ago are given in the table below : Industry. Insured Persons recorded as Unemployed at October 22, 1928. Increase (4-) o compare September 24, 1928. r Decrease (-) d with October 24, 1927. Number. Per-centage. Number. Per cent a^ Number. Latest Figures. The latest figure of unemployment available is that for the 26th November, .1928;1giving a total number on the registers for Great Britain of 1,395,500. This is anincrease over the position on the 22nd October amounting to 51,313, and anincrease over a year ago of 250,270. ARTHUR STEEL-MAITLAND.Ministry of Labour, -December 5, 1928.
